summary: Build "Global Tales Universe" as a mobile-look web app (PWA style): a multi-language short stories reading experience for Adults/Kids with daily featured content, rich reading experience, search/categories, user profiles (guest/login), favorites/history, notifications (placeholder), monetization placeholders (ads + premium subscription/IAP placeholders), offline downloads, and engagement mechanics (streaks/badges/leaderboards/challenges) with 100 dummy stories.
architectural_notes: Use React Native + Expo best practices and provide complete code structure/files.
Use placeholder integrations for translation (e.g., Google Translate), ads (e.g., AdMob), and in-app purchases/subscriptions.
Support multilingual fonts (e.g., Noto Sans for Indic scripts) and translated UI strings across the app.
Implement Adults/Kids content filtering as a core content-layer rule.
Offline downloads require local persistence/caching strategy for story content and metadata.
Project direction change: generate a mobile-look web app with PWA capabilities (web-first, installable) rather than React Native + Expo.

existing_features.title: Create the core app shell for “Global Tales Universe” with a mobile-first responsive layout, including a splash/landing experience and a persistent bottom navigation with tabs: Home, Categories, Search, Favorites, Profile.

Implement light/dark theming with automatic system preference detection and a consistent modern, clean, colorful-but-family-friendly visual style using gradients, cards, and subtle animations across the app.

Add multi-language support for UI strings, categories, and story display language, including a language selector with these options: English, Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Malayalam, Kannada, Bengali, Gujarati, Punjabi, Marathi, Odia, Urdu, Spanish, French, Arabic. Default to English and auto-detect device/browser language when possible.

Create and persist a content model for stories that supports: Adults vs Kids suitability, category, author name, read time, likes, ratings, premium-locked flag, cover image, and multi-language content fields (at least English, Tamil, Hindi). Provide placeholder/duplicated content for additional languages.

Implement the Home screen with: Adults/Kids mode toggle, language selector, a daily featured story card (cover image, title, category, 3-line preview in selected language), horizontal scrolling categories (translated), a “Continue reading” section from reading history, and a vertical “Latest stories” list showing small image, title, author, read time, and likes.

Implement the Story Reading screen with: adjustable font size (small/medium/large), background color options (white/sepia/dark grey/pure black), continuous auto-scroll mode, a progress indicator (% completed), like/favorite button, share action (web share / copy link placeholder), and Next/Previous story navigation.

Add an auto-translate UX for when a story is not available in the currently selected language: show a clear “Translate” control that uses a placeholder translation implementation (no external API calls) and marks the result as translated.
Implement Categories browsing: a Categories tab showing all categories with translated names, category detail pages listing stories in that category, and filters for Adults/Kids mode and language.
Implement Search with: keyword search across title/content keywords/author, optional language filter, and advanced sorting/filter controls: popularity, newest, read time, ratings.

Implement user modes: guest mode by default with optional sign-in via Internet Identity; persist user preferences (preferred language(s), preferred categories, Adults/Kids mode) and reading settings (font size, reading background) per user.

Implement Favorites/Bookmarks: allow users to favorite stories from the Story Reading screen and manage them in a Favorites tab. Favorites must persist for signed-in users and persist locally for guests.

Implement Reading history and “Continue reading”: track last opened story and scroll/progress position, show a continue-reading module on Home, and expose reading history in Profile (or a dedicated section).
Add offline support: allow users to “Download for offline reading” on stories, store downloaded story content locally, and provide an offline-ready reading experience for downloaded items.

Add engagement mechanics: daily streak counter, badges for milestones (e.g., read X stories / X days), reading challenges (e.g., read 5 stories this week), and a leaderboard for most reads. Include a simple “social sharing reward” that unlocks a bonus story after a share action is recorded.

Implement monetization placeholders: banner ad slot on Home and optional inline ad slots between story list items, interstitial ad placeholder after every 3–4 stories opened, rewarded ad placeholder to unlock a premium story, premium gating for some stories, and a “Go Premium” flow with monthly/yearly subscription placeholders that removes ad placeholders and unlocks premium stories and all languages.
Add a daily content mechanic: select a “Daily Featured Story” deterministically per day (and per language/mode when applicable) and ensure it changes day-to-day without requiring manual updates.

Implement a notifications placeholder UX: allow the user to configure “daily new story reminders” by preferred language/category and show an in-app scheduled reminder simulation (no real push notifications).

Ensure Kids mode safety rules are enforced throughout the app: Kids mode must exclude mature categories (at minimum Horror, Romance, Thriller) and only show kid-safe stories; Kids categories should include at minimum Fairy Tales, Educational, Superhero.
Add font handling so Indic/Arabic scripts render correctly by using appropriate web fonts (e.g., Noto Sans families) and apply them based on the selected language/script.
Create and use a set of high-quality static placeholder cover images for featured stories and category/story thumbnails, including kid-friendly variants, and wire them into the dummy story dataset.
Add Progressive Web App (PWA) configuration so Global Tales Universe can be installed to a device home screen and launches in standalone (app-like) mode.
Add a service worker that enables offline-first caching for the app shell (HTML/CSS/JS) and static assets, without breaking existing story offline downloads.
Add install UX: detect when the app is installable (where supported) and show a non-intrusive in-app prompt to install; allow dismissal and do not repeatedly nag after dismissal.

Enhance mobile-web “app-like” presentation in frontend/index.html: add appropriate meta tags for PWA + iOS (apple-touch icon, status bar style) and ensure the viewport is configured for a mobile-first experience.
Add required generated image assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and ensure the app references them as static files (not served by the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: App shell/navigation with splash screen, bottom tabs (Home, Categories, Search, Favorites, Profile), modern themed UI (light/dark auto-detect)
Multilingual support: language selector, auto-detect device language, translated UI strings, category labels per language, font support (e.g., Noto Sans for Indic)
Home screen: daily featured story card, horizontal categories, latest stories list, Adults/Kids mode tabs with content filtering
Story reading screen: adjustable font size, background themes, auto-scroll, progress bar, like/favorite, share, next/previous, auto-translate placeholder
Categories and Search: category pages with Adults/Kids + language filters, search by title/keyword/author/language, sorting (popularity/newest/read time/ratings)
User features: guest mode + optional email/Google login, favorites/bookmarks, reading history/continue reading, profile preferences (languages/categories/age mode)
Notifications: daily new story notifications based on preferred language/categories (placeholder implementation)
Monetization: banner/interstitial/rewarded ads placeholders (e.g., AdMob), premium gating for some stories, Go Premium (remove ads + unlock), subscription placeholders (monthly/yearly)
Offline support: download stories for offline reading
Engagement features: daily streak counter, badges, leaderboards, reading challenges, social sharing rewards (unlock bonus story)

Dummy content: generate 100 sample short stories (adults + kids), 400–1500 words, at least English/Tamil/Hindi with placeholder translations for other languages; fake authors/read times/likes/ratings; kid-safe content
Generate full source code for a mobile-look web app (PWA style) version of Global Tales Universe
